results.title: Rapid improvement of skin lesions in CHILD syndrome with topical 5% simvastatin ointment.
results.text_hl: We report a 10-month-old girl who presented with unilateral scaly @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@ptychotropic plaques@@@, who experienced rapid, near-complete clearance with topical 5% @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ monotherapy twice daily.

citations.NLM: Kallis P, Bisbee E, Garganta C, Schoch JJ. Rapid improvement of skin lesions in CHILD syndrome with topical 5% simvastatin ointment. Pediatr Dermatol. 2022 Jan;39(1):151-152. PMID: 34787337

results.title: Efficacy of simvastatin on carotid atherosclerotic plaque and its effects on serum inflammatory factors and cardiocerebrovascular events in elderly patients
results.text_hl: ORR of the observation group was 93.85%, which was significantly higher than that of the control group (80.00%; P<0.05), suggesting that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ improved the characteristics of the indices of arterial @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@plaques@@@ in elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Carotid_Stenosis @DISEASE_MESH:D016893 @@@CAP@@@ (Table II).

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates plaque inflammation: evaluation by fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ attenuates @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@plaque@@@ @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@: evaluation by @CHEMICAL_Fluorodeoxyglucose_F18 @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019788 @@@fluorodeoxyglucose@@@ positron emission tomography.

results.title: Aortic plaque regression as determined by magnetic resonance imaging with high-dose and low-dose statin therapy.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: We sought to compare the effects of high-dose with low-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ therapy on aortic @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@plaque@@@ morphology using transoesophageal magnetic resonance imaging (TEMRI).

results.title: Ezetimibe reduces plaque inflammation in a rabbit model of atherosclerosis and inhibits monocyte migration in addition to its lipid-lowering effect.
results.text_hl: Importantly, the combination of @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ was associated with a more significant reduction in @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@plaque@@@ monocyte/macrophage content and some proinflammatory markers than observed with each drug alone.

citations.NLM: Gómez-Garre D, Muñoz-Pacheco P, González-Rubio ML, Aragoncillo P, Granados R, Fernández-Cruz A. Ezetimibe reduces plaque inflammation in a rabbit model of atherosclerosis and inhibits monocyte migration in addition to its lipid-lowering effect. Br J Pharmacol. 2009 Apr;156(8):1218-27. PMID: 19222481

results.title: Atheroma stabilizing effects of simvastatin due to depression of macrophages or lipid accumulation in the atheromatous plaques of coronary plaque-prone WHHL rabbits.
results.text_hl: Consequently, the frequency of vulnerable @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@plaque@@@ decreased. In the @DISEASE_Coronary_Aneurysm @DISEASE_MESH:D003323 @@@coronary plaque@@@ of the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group, @GENE_PCNA @GENE_100339381 @@@PCNA@@@-positive cells (which appeared to be macrophages) of the plaques decreased but the TUNEL-positive cells did not show significant change.

citations.NLM: Shiomi M, Yamada S, Ito T. Atheroma stabilizing effects of simvastatin due to depression of macrophages or lipid accumulation in the atheromatous plaques of coronary plaque-prone WHHL rabbits. Atherosclerosis. 2005 Feb;178(2):287-94. PMID: 15694936

results.title: Comparison of the effects of atorvastatin versus simvastatin on subclinical atherosclerosis in primary preventionas determined by electronbeam tomography.
results.text_hl: We conclude that aggressive treatment with @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in the primary prevention population, to similar @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ levels, is associated with equal progression of EBT-determined @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@calcified plaque@@@.

citations.NLM: Hecht HS, Harman SM. Comparison of the effects of atorvastatin versus simvastatin on subclinical atherosclerosis in primary preventionas determined by electronbeam tomography. Am J Cardiol. 2003 Jan 1;91(1):42-5. PMID: 12505569

results.title: The significance of femoral intima-media thickness and plaque scoring in the Atorvastatin versus Simvastatin on Atherosclerosis Progression (ASAP) study.
results.text_hl: No significant differences were obvious between these two treatment arms (P=0.26). Femoral @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@plaques@@@ were present in 64.7% in the @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ group and 56.1% in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group at baseline; after 2 years, these proportions rose to 66.0% (P=0.47) and 67.3% (P=0.02), respectively (P=0.87 between treatment arms).

citations.NLM: van Wissen S, Smilde TJ, de Groot E, Hutten BA, Kastelein JJ, Stalenhoef AF. The significance of femoral intima-media thickness and plaque scoring in the Atorvastatin versus Simvastatin on Atherosclerosis Progression (ASAP) study. Eur J Cardiovasc Prev Rehabil. 2003 Dec;10(6):451-5. PMID: 14671468

results.title: Effect of simvastatin in apolipoprotein E deficient mice with surgically induced chronic renal failure.
results.text_hl: However, @<m>DISEASE_Dental_Plaque</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003773 @@@aortic plaques@@@ in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treated @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ showed significantly less @DISEASE_Calcinosis @DISEASE_MESH:D002114 @@@calcification@@@ than those in controls with @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D051436 @@@chronic kidney disease@@@ (p <0.03).
